alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:22PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central La Paz and northern Yuma Counties through 215 PM MST... At 122 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Brenda to 7 miles east of Kofa Wildlife Refuge. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brenda. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 32 and 49. US Highway 60 between mile markers 32 and 47. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 29 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
